title: Contributing to objr
text: work Scottish Government, request write access repository contacting package maintainers. external, fork repository. Clone repository onto computer crate Git branch changes. Make changes, commit git, create PR. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. means issue automatically close PR merged. Add package maintainers PR reviewers. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Add ‘Authors’ section DESCRIPTION file. rule thumb, please assign role author ("aut") writing exported function, contributor ("ctb") anything else.

title: Contributing to objr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Authentication
text: first time send request, API requires Objective Connect user email address password authenticate. successful response API includes token. token can used authenticate subsequent requests session, negating need repeatedly supply email address password. Depending account /workspace settings, may also required use two-factor mobile authentication. rest article details manage authentication using objr package.

title: Authentication
text: need Objective Connect user email address password make first request API. can provided two ways.

title: Authentication
text: Add two variables .Renviron file define email address password. Open .Renviron file edit: Add two variables follows (replacing XXX credentials): Save close .Renviron file. check worked expected, first restart R session run: credentials printed console. Note: important save R session workspace close console may contain Objective Connect credentials. benefit method can leave information .Renviron file objr automatically find time use package.
code: usethis::edit_r_environ() OBJR_USR = "XXX" OBJR_PWD = "XXX" Sys.getenv("OBJR_USR") Sys.getenv("OBJR_PWD")

title: Authentication
text: don’t variables defined .Renviron file, objr prompt supply ’re working interactive session.

title: Authentication
text: successful API response includes token can used subsequent requests. objr functions automatically parse token API response store R session’s global environment (token). object exists, objr automatically use authenticate subsequent requests. object doesn’t exist, objr resort using username password, first request.

title: Authentication
text: Tokens expire unused 20 minutes . can see expiry time current token viewing token$expiry. try make request expired token environment, removed, objr try use username password instead. Note using mobile authentication, still fail, login using mobile_auth_login() generate new token.

title: Authentication
text: Two-factor authentication (2FA) may enforced workspaces. using Objective Connect browser, means need enter code emailed completing certain tasks. use objr workspaces, users must given permission bypass 2FA. information guidance set available Two-factor authentication article.

title: Authentication
text: Mobile authentication may enforced workspaces, may enabled . Guidance enable, register disable mobile authentication available Objective Connect Help documentation. can view status mobile authentication account using mobile_auth_status(). example: enabled mobile authentication registered mobile device, need login using mobile authentication using objr functionality. can done using mobile_auth_login(). function requires username password authentication first request. can either provide authentication code mobile device directly function: , left empty, prompted enter code pop-window:  login successful, token API response stored automatically used subsequent requests. Tokens expire unused 20 minutes - happens, need login using mobile authenticator . Mobile authentication login attempts limited maximum 5 failures within 5-minute interval. 5 failed attempts, Objective Connect account locked. regain access, wait 5 mins try logging .
code: mobile_auth_status() ## $mobileAuthLogin ## [1] TRUE ##  ## $mobileAuthRegistered ## [1] TRUE mobile_auth_login("123456") mobile_auth_login() ## ✔ Successfully logged in via Mobile Authenticator.

what: What is the difference between users and participants?
title: Frequently Asked Questions
text: user individual using Objective Connect. participant user particular workspace. example, person using Objective Connect User UUID associated , also Participant UUID individual workspace member . user can get User UUID running my_user_id(). user can find participant UUID particular workspace using participants().

what: Can I use the objr package to interact with eRDM?
title: Frequently Asked Questions
text: Unfortunately, . Although eRDM Connect Objective products, API’s considerably different. objr package currently works Objective Connect , although may developed future work eRDM.

what: Can I use objr with two-factor or mobile authentication?
title: Frequently Asked Questions
text: Yes. following articles provide information use : Two-factor authentication Mobile authentication

title: Introduction to objr
text: useful aware everything Objective Connect associated Universally Unique Identifier (UUID). includes users, workgroups, workspaces, participants workspace assets workspace. Objective Connect UUIDs take form string eight chunks four lower case letters numbers, separated dashes. example: Use API objr package depends UUIDs. UUIDs mostly findable using functions objr (demonstrated article), however can often also find relevant UUIDs webpage URLs. example, example URL viewing workspace: UUID workspace 2vo2-dd3s-1nn9-y20r-b906-u4s2-7134-b352 UUID workgroup 2j47-ff38-lcgg-mnis-3vq8-9536-9jfp-oy44.
code: 84op-9qdu-c692-t4z1-wa4z-h9k3-8454-i71f https://secure.objectiveconnect.co.uk/share/2vo2-dd3s-1nn9-y20r-b906-u4s2- 7134-b352?workgroupUuid=2j47-ff38-lcgg-mnis-3vq8-9536-9jfp-oy44

title: Introduction to objr
text: interact Objective Connect API, must provide valid authentication. explained detail vignette("authentication"). might good idea test authentication, especially ’s first time using package. specific function , following simple function get user ID requires input easy way test can get successful response API.
code: me <- my_user_id()

title: Introduction to objr
text: see workspaces member : returns data frame row workspace member . Among things, column containing workspace name another containing workspace UUID. example:
code: workspaces <- workspaces() ##   workspace_name                          workspace_uuid ## 1      Project 1 84op-9qdu-c692-t4z1-wa4z-h9k3-8454-i71f ## 2      Project 2 2vo2-dd3s-1nn9-y20r-b906-u4s2-7134-b352

title: Introduction to objr
text: Maybe like download file one workspaces. Objective Connect, files also known ‘assets’. download asset, ’ll need UUID. Note: workspaces two-factor authentication (2FA) enabled, participants use API workspace level actions unless given permission bypass 2FA. See vignette("two-factor") information. Use workspace UUID workspaces get data frame assets workspace: returns data frame row asset workspace. Among things, column containing asset name another containing asset UUID.
code: assets <- assets("84op-9qdu-c692-t4z1-wa4z-h9k3-8454-i71f") ##   asset_name asset_ext                              asset_uuid ## 1      file1      docx 2j47-ff38-lcgg-mnis-3vq8-9536-9jfp-oy44 ## 2      file2       csv l588-e8wp-d6y8-3d01-blby-wag1-ks1s-gmo9

title: Introduction to objr
text: download document, use UUID file path folder ’d like downloaded file saved : function doesn’t return anything display message R console indicate download success confirm location file:
code: download_file(document_uuid = "2j47-ff38-lcgg-mnis-3vq8-9536-9jfp-oy44",               folder = here::here("data")) ## ✔ File downloaded: project-1/data/file1.docx.

title: Introduction to objr
text: Alternatively, can read data file directly R environment: Accepted data file formats csv, rds, xlsx parquet.
code: x <- read_data(document_uuid = "l588-e8wp-d6y8-3d01-blby-wag1-ks1s-gmo9")

title: Introduction to objr
text: upload file workspace, use UUID workspace file path file upload: function doesn’t return anything display message R console indicate upload success confirm name file. Now, rerun previous step get data frame workspace assets, see additional row file ’ve just uploaded.
code: upload_file(here::here("data", "file3.csv"),             workspace_uuid = "84op-9qdu-c692-t4z1-wa4z-h9k3-8454-i71f") ## ✔ New document created: file3.csv. assets <- assets("84op-9qdu-c692-t4z1-wa4z-h9k3-8454-i71f") ##   asset_name asset_ext                              asset_uuid ## 1      file1      docx 2j47-ff38-lcgg-mnis-3vq8-9536-9jfp-oy44 ## 2      file2       csv l588-e8wp-d6y8-3d01-blby-wag1-ks1s-gmo9 ## 3      file3       csv 9tp8-3vme-d381-7o89-4qns-qw99-310b-3d06

title: Introduction to objr
text: Alternatively, can write data directly R:
code: write_data(mtcars,            file_name = "mtcars",            file_type = "rds",            workspace_uuid = "84op-9qdu-c692-t4z1-wa4z-h9k3-8454-i71f") assets <- assets("84op-9qdu-c692-t4z1-wa4z-h9k3-8454-i71f") ##   asset_name asset_ext                              asset_uuid ## 1      file1      docx 2j47-ff38-lcgg-mnis-3vq8-9536-9jfp-oy44 ## 2      file2       csv l588-e8wp-d6y8-3d01-blby-wag1-ks1s-gmo9 ## 3      file3       csv 9tp8-3vme-d381-7o89-4qns-qw99-310b-3d06 ## 4     mtcars       rds fh84-jbdy-g6kp-68z8-gt3v-ds39-x74p-80m3

title: Two-Factor Authentication
text: workspaces two-factor authentication (2FA) enabled, participants won’t able use API unless given permission bypass 2FA. check participants permission bypass 2FA, run participants() using workspace UUID, inspect bypass_2fa column returned data frame. set 2FA bypassing workspace, ’ll need help workgroup administrator workspace owner. three main steps complete process: Give permission change 2FA bypass settings workgroup Give permission workspace owner Give permission workspace participants steps need carried can use objr (API general) first time. start, ’ll need name UUID workgroup workspace. information find UUIDs can found Getting Started page.

what: A note for non R users
title: Two-Factor Authentication
text: required changes can made using API (Objective Connect browser interface). either Workgroup Admin Workspace Owner R user, can use API via ’s interactive documentation instead using objr. Links relevant sections interactive documentation provided step . detailed guidance use interactive documentation available Getting help section.

what: Permission to change 2FA settings in the workgroup
title: Two-Factor Authentication
text: steps must completed workgroup admin. work Scottish Government, please contact package maintainers arrange step. Temporarily disable mandatory 2FA workgroup. can done one following ways: Navigate summary page workgroup Objective Connect. Select ‘Workgroup Options’, un-check option ‘Enforce Two-step verification’, click blue ‘Update’ button.  R, use workgroup_mandate_2fa(), providing relevant workgroup UUID setting mandate = FALSE disable. example: reinstate mandatory 2FA later, set mandate = TRUE. Non R users can also use interactive documentation disable mandatory 2FA workgroup. R, allow 2FA bypassing workgroup using workgroup_bypass_2fa(), providing relevant workgroup UUID. example: Non R users can use interactive documentation allow 2FA bypassing workgroup. Continue next section give workspace owner permission bypass 2FA. complete, reinstate mandatory 2FA workgroup.
code: workgroup_mandate_2fa("v09y-g5vk-5348-k68t-s462-c2vs-7kl8-7440", mandate = FALSE) ## ✔ Mandatory 2FA setting successfully updated for workgroup. workgroup_bypass_2fa("v09y-g5vk-5348-k68t-s462-c2vs-7kl8-7440") ## ✔ Bypass 2FA setting successfully updated for workgroup.

title: Two-Factor Authentication
text: steps must completed workspace owner. Navigate summary page workspace Objective Connect. Select three dots icon (…) top right-hand corner, Two-step verification. prompted confirm, select Disable.  R, give (workspace owner) permission bypass 2FA using participant_bypass_2fa(). need participant UUID, can found using participants(). example, Non R users can use interactive documentation find relevant participant UUID allow participant 2FA bypassing. Check worked using participants(). bypass_2fa column returned data frame contain TRUE name. Non R users can use interactive documentation view participant settings. Reinstate 2FA workspace using method step 1. workgroup admin can now reinstate mandatory 2FA workgroup.
code: participant_bypass_2fa("z98a-9sy0-b3gv-285m-39k6-20d5-dg6k-3gue") ## ✔ Bypass 2FA setting successfully updated for participant.

title: Two-Factor Authentication
text: steps must completed workspace owner. R, give participants permission bypass 2FA using participant_bypass_2fa(). need relevant members’ participant UUID, can found using participants(). Non R users can use interactive documentation find relevant participant UUID allow participant 2FA bypassing. Scottish Government Objective Connect workspaces, bypassing permissions limited Scottish Government staff given external workspace participants. wish revoke permissions bypass 2FA, use participant_bypass_2fa() set allow_bypass = FALSE. Remember, check status 2FA bypassing participants workspace, use participants().

title: Two-Factor Authentication

title: Two-Factor Authentication
text: required changes can made using API. either Workgroup Admin Workspace Owner R user, can use API via ’s interactive documentation instead using objr. Links relevant sections interactive documentation provided step . using interactivity, set API authentication clicking green ‘Authorise’ button (near top page right hand side).  pop-window, enter username (usually email address) password Objective Connect, click ‘Authorize’ button.  use API within section, click ‘Try ’ button. able enter values required parameters.  supplied required information, click blue ‘Execute’ button send API request. able see API response, whether successful.

code: @Manual{,   title = {objr: Wrapper for Objective APIs},   author = {Alice Hannah},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.2.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/ScotGovAnalysis/objr}, }

title: Wrapper for Objective APIs
text: objr (pronounced “ob-jar”) aims provide convenient method interacting Objective Connect using R, making use Objective Connect API.

title: Wrapper for Objective APIs
text: working within Scottish Government network, can install objr way R packages. easiest way using pkginstaller add-. guidance available eRDM. Alternatively, objr can installed directly GitHub. Note method requires remotes package may work within Scottish Government network. Finally, objr can also installed downloading zip repository running following code, replacing section marked <> (including arrows ) location downloaded zip:
code: remotes::install_github(   "ScotGovAnalysis/objr",   upgrade = "never",   build_vignettes = TRUE ) remotes::install_local(   "<FILEPATH OF ZIPPED FILE>/objr-main.zip",   upgrade = "never",   build_vignettes = TRUE )

title: Wrapper for Objective APIs
text: installed, objr can loaded using library() function: Help files function package can found References page package website. Alternatively, type ?function_name RStudio console. example: also demonstration simple workflow using package vignette("objr").
code: library(objr) ?workspaces()

title: Wrapper for Objective APIs
text: Unless stated otherwise, codebase released MIT Licence. covers codebase sample code documentation. documentation © Crown copyright available terms Open Government 3.0 licence.

what: Add participant(s) to a workspace — add_participants
title: Add participant(s) to a workspace — add_participants
text: Add participant(s) workspace

title: Add participant(s) to a workspace — add_participants
code: add_participants(   workspace_uuid,   emails,   message = NULL,   permissions = NULL,   member_visibility = c("standard", "bcc"),   send_email_invite = TRUE,   use_proxy = FALSE )

title: Add participant(s) to a workspace — add_participants
text: workspace_uuid UUID workspace. emails Character vector email addresses send invites . message Optionally, message include email invite. permissions Optionally, character vector permissions give invited participants. Valid permissions : "Download", "CreateDocument", "CreateFolder", "Edit", "Delete", "EditOnline", "Inviter", "Commenter" "ManageWorkspace". members given permission preview documents. member_visibility Either "standard" (default) make new participants visible workspace members, "bcc" hide participants. send_email_invite Default TRUE send email invite participants join workspace. FALSE, email sent. use_proxy Logical indicate whether use proxy.

title: Add participant(s) to a workspace — add_participants

title: Core request function — objr
text: Core request function

title: Core request function — objr
code: objr(   endpoint,   url_path = NULL,   url_query = NULL,   method = "GET",   body = NULL,   path = NULL,   accept = "application/json",   content_type = "application/json",   use_proxy = FALSE )

title: Core request function — objr
text: endpoint endpoint append API server address. url_path list values added request URL path. Values separated /. url_query list named values define query parameters. method HTTP method use; e.g. "GET", "POST", "PUT". Defaults "GET". body list named values passed request body. path Optional file path save body request (mainly used downloading files). accept Accept header. Defaults "application/json". content_type Content-Type header. Defaults "application/json". use_proxy Logical indicate whether use proxy.

title: Core request function — objr
text: API response.

title: Core request function — objr
text: API authentication handled automatically. See Authentication article information. details endpoints available API documentation.

title: objr (development version)
text: Fix bug downloaded files MIME encoded-word syntax (#72).

title: objr 0.2.0
text: New mobile_auth_status() mobile_auth_login() support use mobile authentication (#52). New workgroup_mandate_2fa() provides ability enable disable mandatory two-factor authentication (2FA) workgroups (#65). read_data() write_data() now support reading writing parquet files (#54). download_file() gains file_name argument supply custom name (#37).

title: objr 0.2.0
text: assets(), type now expects string instead list. prompted change underlying API, results can now filtered one asset type time (#53).

title: objr 0.2.0
text: Expiry time now stored alongside authentication token (token). token expired, removed Global Environment authentication attempted username password instead (#35). download_file() now returns file path (invisibly) (#38). download_file() now writes files percent-decoded names (e.g. file%20name.csv now file name.csv) (#34). Fixed issue temporary files sometimes persisted running download_file() read_data() (#39).

title: objr 0.1.1
text: Set minimum versions dplyr tidyr dependencies (#32).

title: objr 0.1.0
text: First package release. Add pkgdown site (https://ScotGovAnalysis.github.io/objr).
